title: Human-Centered Design Practicum for Digital Behavioral Health Intervention Development

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental digital literacy and understanding of health behavior theory
context.additional_context: The learner group consists of university students with diverse academic backgrounds, who experience the digital mediation design process through real-world case studies

learning_goals: A digital behavioral health intervention prototype can be developed by applying the Human-Centered Design (HCD) process.
Intervention content can be improved by systematically collecting and analyzing user feedback.
Behavior change strategies can be designed using six internet-based core components.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
